title: Network Penetration
description: Learn advanced techniques for penetration testing and securing networks.
fullDescription: This advanced course covers network penetration testing methodologies used by security professionals. You'll learn vulnerability scanning, exploitation techniques, post-exploitation, and how to write comprehensive reports. The course includes hands-on labs with virtualized environments to practice real-world scenarios.
author: Cybersecurity Training

title: Cryptography
description: Master encryption algorithms and cryptographic protocols.
fullDescription: The cryptography module teaches both theoretical and practical aspects of modern cryptography. Starting with fundamentals like symmetric and asymmetric encryption, you'll progress to implementing secure protocols, understanding attacks against cryptographic systems, and learning best practices for implementing cryptography in applications.
author: Security Academy
skills: Cryptographic hash functions and digital signatures
Key exchange protocols and certificate management
Cryptographic library usage and best practices

title: Malware Analysis
description: Techniques for analyzing and understanding malware behavior.
fullDescription: This comprehensive malware analysis course teaches both static and dynamic analysis techniques. You'll dissect real malware samples in a secure environment, learn to recognize common malware behaviors, use specialized tools to unpack and deobfuscate malicious code, and develop custom analysis scripts to automate the process.
author: Malware Tech

title: OSINT Techniques
fullDescription: Open-source intelligence (OSINT) is the art of gathering and analyzing publicly available information. This course covers methodologies and tools used by security researchers to collect intelligence from various sources including social media, public records, and online documents. You'll learn to create profiles, track digital footprints, and document findings professionally.
author: Intel Techniques
skills: Ethical and legal considerations in OSINT

title: Reverse Engineering
description: Disassemble and analyze binaries to understand their functionality.
fullDescription: Reverse engineering is the process of deconstructing software to understand its inner workings. This advanced course covers assembly language fundamentals, disassemblers, debuggers, and decompilers. You'll analyze increasingly complex binaries, bypass anti-reverse engineering measures, and learn to extract key algorithms and data structures from compiled code.
author: Binary Ninja
skills: Analysis of obfuscated and packed code

title: Mobile Security
description: Security vulnerabilities and countermeasures for mobile applications.
fullDescription: Mobile devices present unique security challenges. This intermediate course covers the security architecture of Android and iOS platforms, common vulnerabilities in mobile applications, and techniques for assessing mobile app security. You'll learn to use specialized tools for dynamic analysis, static code review, and API security assessment.
author: Mobile App Security
